greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiples of 13 and odd numbers interleaved.
comment: Partial sums give the generalized 17-gonal numbers (A303305).
More generally, the partial sums of the sequence formed by the multiples of m and the odd numbers interleaved, give the generalized k-gonal numbers, with m >= 1 and k = m + 4.
a(n) is also the length of the n-th line segment of the rectangular spiral whose vertices are the generalized 17-gonal numbers.
link: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,0,-1).
program: (PARI) a(n) = if(n%2==0, return((n/2)*13), return(n)) \\ _Felix Fröhlich_, Jul 26 2018
xref: Sequences whose partial sums give the generalized k-gonal numbers: A026741 (k=5), A001477 (k=6), zero together with A080512 (k=7), A022998 (k=8), A195140 (k=9), zero together with A165998 (k=10), A195159 (k=11), A195161 (k=12), A195312 k=13), A195817 (k=14), A317311 (k=15), A317312 (k=16).
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jul 25 2018
